headline.main: Seeking a Kabul Coalition, Killings in Kunduz and Bodies in the Rubble
headline.kicker: A NATION CHALLENGED: AN OVERVIEW: NOV. 18, 2001

lead_paragraph: After six weeks, the end of the war in Afghanistan may be glimpsed, with Taliban forces clinging to their last two strongholds. But to win the peace, the United States wants a broad-based government in Kabul, and the Northern Alliance has finally said it will join other anti-Taliban factions in discussing it. AVOIDING POLITICAL LIMBO -- An agreement to get such talks started, perhaps in a few days in Europe, was announced by the alliance foreign minister, Abdullah Abdullah, and the American diplomat James Dobbins in Uzbekistan. United Nations officials were negotiating to set things up. The objective: a Kabul coalition that would fairly represent Afghanistan's endlessly warring tribal factions.
abstract: Overview of day's events in war on terrorism, including fighting fires that continue at World Trade Center, counting bodies at Mazar-i-Sharif following Taliban's surrender of city, and seeking to form broad-based government in Kabul
